bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 18, 1898

div1.p: Lazear writes about searching for a new house.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 18, 1898
div1.p:
We caught
our train all night on
Friday but the common
car was so crowded
and hot and uncomfortable
that we had to weaken
and take seats in the
Pullman car. Fortunately
it was a through southern
train and had sleeping-
cars. These are more
comfortable than the
Pastor cars, I think.
We went right to work
yesterday on the house-hunting.

There were several
available houses and
the in particular I
think is just the thing.

It is on Park Ave, a
few doors from the Denegan
house. It sits back
in the lot. It looks very
comfortable and I
think Mabel can make
it very beautiful. It has
one less room than this
house. The rent is only
twenty-five dollars a month. It is
much more, suitable as an
office than this and as the rent
is so low. I could afford to
have an office elsewhere with
Dr. Atkinson. That however is only
a possibility.

Francis came to see us this morning.
All as well at Windsor. They were
wandering what had become of you.
Uncle Tom left last Tuesday.

Mabel tells me to say she will
write as soon as she can and
tell you how much she enjoyed
the visit and the watch.

It was certainly awfully nice of
you to give as such a treat.
